head.supplied: 22/5/94. ¶ ¶ By some misunderstanding, dear Dr Bride, I received from my London-Bookseller two sets of Saccardo's Sylloge, excerpt vol. IV. ¶ As it seemed a pity, to let so valuable a work go again ...

div.p: VPRS 805/P000O/179/94-700, inward and outward correspondence — subject, VA 913 Public Library of Victoria, Public Record Office, Victoria.

By some misunderstanding, dear Dr Bride, I received from my London-Bookseller two sets of Saccardo's Sylloge, excerpt vol. IV.
Saccardo (1882-1931); i.e. up to vol. 10, published in 1892, since vol. 11 did not appear until 1895 (TL2).
As it seemed a pity, to let so valuable a work go again out of the colony I presented the incomplete set. I see no other means of completing your set than by sending an order to Europe for the wanting volume.
MS annotation: 'Vol. 4 of Work ordered from Melville, Mullen and Slade 12.3.96'.
